title: 103_hr2013
content: The "Commission on Filipino Veterans Entitlement Act" establishes the Commission on Filipino War Veterans Entitlement to carry out specific duties. The Commission on Filipino War Veterans Entitlement is tasked with reviewing provisions denying benefits to Filipino veterans of World War II, assessing existing benefits, determining fair benefits due to veterans, and recommending changes in law. Public hearings will be held in various cities including Manila, Cebu, and Davao in the Philippines, as well as Los Angeles. The Commission on Filipino War Veterans Entitlement will hold public hearings in various cities including Manila, Cebu, and Davao in the Philippines, as well as Los Angeles, California; Chicago, Illinois; Houston, Texas; New York, New York; Washington, DC; and Honolulu, Hawaii. A report of findings and recommendations will be submitted to Congress by October 1, 1994. SEC. 4. MEMBERSHIP. The Commission shall consist of seven members appointed by the President, Speaker of the House, and President pro tempore of the Senate. Members serve for the life of the Commission, vacancies are filled in the same manner as the original appointment. The first meeting must be called within 60 days of the Act's enactment. A quorum is four members, and the Commission elects a chairman. The Commission consists of seven members appointed by various officials, with a chairman and vice chairman elected from among its members. Members receive compensation for their duties and expenses incurred. The Commission, subcommittees, or members can hold hearings, request witnesses and documents, and subpoena information. They can also request information from executive agencies. The Commission can request information from executive agencies to assist in its duties. SEC. 6. ADMINISTRATIVE PROVISIONS. The Commission is authorized to appoint personnel, set compensation, hire experts and consultants, and enter agreements for necessary services. Compensation cannot exceed the rate of GS-18 of the General Schedule. Payment for administrative services will be reimbursed from Commission funds as agreed upon by the Chairman and the Administrator. The Commission can procure supplies, services, and property by contract and enter into contracts with Federal or State agencies, private firms, institutions, and agencies for research, surveys, and other activities necessary for its duties. The Commission will terminate on February 1, 1995. $2,000,000 is authorized for carrying out the provisions of this Act.
